page.title: 09People Of Coalville:
page.content: INTERVIEWS WITH SOME LOCAL CHARACTERS: -------------------------------------- {G.W. Fox: Mr. G.W. Fox has lived in Coalville for twenty years. He came here in 1939 when he was eleven years old. When he first came to Coalville the most important means of transport was the railway, which ran from Leicester, through Coalville, onto Burton-On-Trent.{Midland Red}was the main bus service, there were also smaller ones like{Ickwells}and{ {Brudins.}Buses were smaller, there would be a driver and conductor. They had hard seats and were not so comfortable. In the summer private companies ran to{Skegness}and{ {Blackpool.}All the pits worked including{Snibstone, South Leicester and{Ellistown. Wuttons}was the oldest workshop in Coalville.
